meanings.definition: The quality of being shy or reserved.
meanings.sent1: Her coyness made it difficult for her to speak up in class.
meanings.sent2: His coyness often led others to perceive him as aloof.
meanings.sent3: Despite her coyness, she managed to make friends easily.
meanings.sent4: The coyness of the forest creatures added to the mysterious atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The coyness of the kitten as it approached the stranger was endearing.

meanings.definition: The act of feigning shyness or reluctance.
meanings.sent1: Her coyness was just an act to avoid doing the presentation.
meanings.sent2: His coyness in accepting the award seemed insincere.
meanings.sent3: The coyness with which he declined the invitation was quite obvious.
meanings.sent4: Her coyness in pretending not to know the answer was amusing.
meanings.sent5: The coyness of his excuses was transparent to everyone.

meanings.sent1: Her coyness in flirting with him was evident to all.
meanings.sent2: His coyness in teasing her showed his playful side.
meanings.sent3: The coyness with which they exchanged glances was charming.
meanings.sent4: Her coyness in the dance made her the center of attention.
meanings.sent5: The coyness of his smile hinted at a mischievous nature.
